# Organizational Functions

Institutional functional departments support the HKMA's operations, ensuring high transparency and accountability, and demonstrating exceptional efficiency and professional standards. To promote public understanding of the HKMA's policies and work, the HKMA actively maintains communication with the broader society and market participants through traditional and social media, the HKMA website, the HKMA Information Centre, and other channels.

Internally, the HKMA is committed to establishing a flexible, responsive, and professional work team, while adhering to strict fiscal discipline and enhancing digital capabilities to respond to changes and ensure the effective implementation of all policies and measures.

# Maintain Transparency

# Media Relations and Social Media Applications

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) maintains close communication with the media to enhance transparency and promote public understanding of its policies and operations. In 2024, the HKMA organized or participated in 207 events, including 14 press conferences, four media briefings, 14 on-site interviews, and 175 other public events. To enhance public understanding of the HKMA's core functions, the HKMA held press conferences and media briefings for local, mainland, and international media, covering topics such as tokenization, anti-fraud measures, and support measures for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Throughout the year, the HKMA also arranged 25 media interviews, issued approximately 600 bilingual press releases, and addressed a large number of daily media inquiries.

Mr. Yu Weiwén, Chairman, received on-site media interviews at the 'Hong Kong Financial Technology Week 2024'

Mr. Li Dazhi, Vice President, delivered a welcome speech on the day of the "Hukou Hulian" example demonstration.

Media representatives actively participated in the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's events held in 2024, especially the third session of the "International Financial Leaders Investment Summit." The summit, which lasted three days, received over 10,000 news reports from local, mainland, and international media.

Mr. Yu Weiwén, Chairman, accepted a live media interview at the "International Financial Leaders Investment Summit 2024"

Mr. Ruan Guoheng, Vice President, hosted a media briefing on the establishment of the Special Task Force on SME Financing.

Mr. Chen Weimin, Vice President, delivered the opening speech at the "2024 Financial Markets Summit"

To more effectively engage the public, the HKMA operates six social media pages (including Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, WeChat, X (formerly known as Twitter), and YouTube), which have over 200,000 followers. The HKMA produces creative social media content to raise public awareness of various topics and initiatives, such as fraud prevention, fintech, green and sustainable finance, support for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), and major events hosted by the HKMA. The HKMA also live-streams the "International Financial Leaders Investment Summit" on its social media pages to promote public and industry participation.

Publishing creative content on social media helps increase public awareness of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's measures and various issues.

# Public Inquiry

The Monetary Authority's public inquiry service provides citizens with an effective channel to enhance their understanding of the Monetary Authority's main functions and operations.

The Public Inquiry Service handled a total of 9,594 queries in 2024 (Figure 1), all of which were responded to within the HKMA's service commitment timeframe (Table 1). About half of these queries related to bank consumer issues, financial infrastructure and bond market development, banking policies and regulations, and currency (Figure 2). Common queries included the coin collection program, banking products and services, retail bond issuance plan, banking-related guidelines and announcements, and the 'FPS' (Fast Payment System).

# Publications

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority published the "2023 Annual Report" and the "2023 Sustainability Report" this year. The "2023 Sustainability Report" received the Award of Commendation in the "Public/Non-Profit Organizations (Large)" category at the Hong Kong Institute of Accountants' "Best Corporate Governance and ESG Award 2024." In addition, the "2023 Annual Report" was awarded a Bronze Award in the "Non-Profit and Charitable Organizations" category at the Hong Kong Institute of Management's 2024 Annual Best Annual Report Awards.

In 2024, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority regularly updates the "Financial Data Monthly Report" 1 data and publishes:

Two Issues of the Semi-annual Report on Monetary and Financial Stability; Four Issues of the Quarterly Report; and 14 Articles of "Huishi".

# Organization Website

The HKMA's website (www.hkma.gov.hk) provides over 73,000 pages of information in English and Chinese in both simplified and traditional characters, facilitating the public's access to the latest information from the HKMA. The website also contains the "Register of Recognized Institutions and Local Representatives' Offices" and "Register of Recognized Institution Securities Business Employees" maintained under Section 20 of the Banking Ordinance, as well as the "Register of Stored Value Payment Tool Licensees" kept under the Payment Systems and Stored Value Payment Tools Ordinance.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has been implementing a phased release of financial data and important information hosted on its website through open application programming interfaces (open APIs) since 2018. As of the end of 2024, we have launched a total of 177 sets of open APIs on the website in accordance with the original plan. For more detailed information on the HKMA's open APIs, please visit the HKMA Open API Gateway website (https://apidocs.hkma.gov.hk).

# Information Center

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's Information Centre is located on the 55th floor, Phase 2, International Finance Centre, divided into two parts: an exhibition hall and a library. Its purpose is to introduce the Authority's work to the public and enhance public awareness of currency and banking matters. The exhibition hall provides an interactive overview of the Authority's functions and the development of Hong Kong's currency and banking sectors, while also offering materials and exhibits for research on Hong Kong's currency, banking, and financial affairs.

The information center welcomed over 68,000 visitors this year, a 120% increase from 2023. The information center also provided over 570 guided tours for schools and other groups.

The library, located adjacent to the exhibition hall, houses over 26,000 books, journals, and other publications covering topics such as Hong Kong currency, banking, finance, and central banking affairs. The library also maintains the "Register of Recognized Institutions and Local Representatives" and the "Register of Recognized Institutions' Securities Business Employees," as stipulated in Section 20 of the Banking Ordinance, for public reference.

Kindergarten children participated in a guided tour of the information center to learn about the design of Hong Kong banknotes.

Information center staff introduced visitors to a mosaic artwork constructed from Hong Kong coins, showcasing Victoria Harbour scenery.

# Community Contact and Public Education

To enhance public understanding of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's work, the Authority has been organizing public education seminars since 1998, with over 68,000 participants to date. In 2024, we held an online seminar, attracting over 800 students and teachers from 41 secondary schools. The seminar covered topics including an introduction to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, the Linked Exchange Rate System, Hong Kong banknotes, fraud prevention, the Deposit Protection Scheme, green finance, and opportunities for development in the banking industry.

We use various channels to contact and educate the public on how to be savvy and responsible financial services consumers. The 2024 activities attracted a combined total of over 67,000 citizens to participate.

To align with the trend of digital payments and green living, we promote through social media and radio, encouraging citizens to distribute electronic red envelopes during the Lunar New Year period, and they may also consider distributing physical red envelopes using "Welcome Notes."

Producing an animated short film encourages the distribution of electronic red envelopes.

# Anti-Scam Song — "Link Mi Random Tap"

To further strengthen anti-fraud efforts, we have launched an anti-fraud song performed by Mr. Yuen Kwong, a singer, and Mr. Yuen Guoheng, Deputy Governor of the Monetary Authority, reminding citizens to "Don't take fake links as genuine, don't give them away" and to properly safeguard sensitive personal data and credit card information. The cross-media campaign's effectiveness has been recognized and has received international acclaim.

Mr. Guanheng Ruan (Vice President, on the right) participated in performing an anti-fraud song.

Cross-media publicity campaign enhances public awareness of fraud prevention.

# Cross-Border Wealth Management: New Opportunities TV Short Video Series

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority, in collaboration with a local television station, jointly produced a series of TV short films titled "New Opportunities for Cross-border Wealth Management" to help citizens further understand the opportunities and conveniences that the "Cross-border Wealth Management" initiative (Cross-border Wealth Management) brings to retail investors for cross-border investments. This short film series uses classic scenes from five iconic Hong Kong films to explain the framework of Cross-border Wealth Management, investors' eligibility requirements, products offered through the "Northbound Channel" and "Southbound Channel," risk management, and key considerations for cross-border investments. The series will be promoted through television, digital platforms, and social media.

The short video humorously introduces "Cross-border Wealth Management Connect."

# All Hong Kong Wealth Management Rivalry Battle

To enhance secondary students' financial literacy, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority collaborates with multiple relevant organizations to host the "Hong Kong Financial Literacy Championship." This event marks its 10th anniversary in 2024, with the theme "Future Financial Talent," aiming to enable secondary students to gain early exposure to developments and future trends in innovation, fintech, and artificial intelligence, as well as promoting students' adherence to the principles of sustainable development, environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices.

The first part of the Championship Battle is an online quiz competition that tests participants' financial knowledge and understanding of popular financial topics. In 2024, 32,000 participants from 290 schools took part in the online quiz competition, setting a new record. Between 2015 and 2024, students from 440 schools participated in the online quiz环节 of the Championship Battle approximately 125,000 times. The second part of the Championship Battle, the "Youth Financial Talent Program," is conducted in a mentorship format, with senior professionals from various fields serving as mentors to train students for the "Design Thinking Challenge." In 2024, this part of the Championship Battle introduced a special "Greater Bay Area Invitational" to promote interaction and exchange among students from Guangdong, Hong Kong, and Macau.

Mr. Chen Weimin, Vice President, delivered a welcome speech at the championship final and encouraged the participants.

Students participating in the "Youth Financial Talent Program" meet with their mentors.

# Educational Tabletop Games

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority launched its first financial education board game, "$mart理財321," in 2023 and continued to promote it in 2024 to raise public awareness of this original board game and strengthen its role as an educational tool, enabling primary school students to learn about various payment methods, basic financial concepts, fintech, and cybersecurity through simulated scenarios.

At the community level, we set up a booth at the "Hong Kong Book Fair 2024," hosted workshops in the community during Christmas and Lunar New Year, and organized family workshops at the HKMA offices, further promoting financial and literacy concepts. Additionally, we arranged school activities for primary students to try out board games and conducted training workshops to encourage secondary school teachers to use board games as teaching materials in the financial education unit of the newly established subject "Citizenship, Economics, and Society." Board games have been recognized by the Education Bureau as one of the outstanding teaching tools and were used as prizes for the winning schools in the "Financial Literacy School Award Scheme (2023/24)." The HKMA held approximately 40 board game workshops in 2024, attracting over 3,600 participants, including students, parents, teachers, and social workers.

Building on the experience of developing the $smart理財321 board game, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority launched the strategy board game "Corporate Green Transformation," which was distributed as a souvenir at the Hong Kong Book Fair 2024 booth. This is the first board game in Hong Kong to convey green finance knowledge to students.

In addition, we continue to support the work of the Investors and Financial Education Committee to enhance the financial knowledge and wealth management capabilities of Hong Kong residents, and will explore further collaboration with various stakeholders to enhance the effectiveness of community participation initiatives.

Promote financial education to teachers, students, and parents through board game activities.

# Financial Disclosure

To maintain high transparency, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority adopts international financial disclosure standards applicable to central bank operations, including the Hong Kong Financial Reporting Standards and the International Monetary Fund's Data Dissemination Standards. The Financial Department prepares the Exchange Fund financial statements with the assistance of independent auditors and other accounting professionals in accordance with the Hong Kong Financial Reporting Standards. In addition, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority provides detailed disclosure and in-depth analysis of budget and expenditure data in its Annual Report (please refer to Section "Budget Preparation and Financial Control" on pages 193 to 194).

# 意見

茲證明我已審計列載於第209至309頁外匯基金及其附屬公司（「集團」）的財務報表，該等財務報表包括外匯基金及集團於2024年12月31日的資產負債表與截至該日止年度的收支帳目、全面收益表、權益變動表和現金流量表，以及財務報表的附註，包括重大會計政策資料。

我認為，該等財務報表已按照香港會計師公會頒布的《香港財務報告會計準則》真實而中肯地反映外匯基金及集團於2024年12月31日的財務狀況及截至該日止年度的財務表現和現金流量，並已按照行政長官在《外匯基金條例》（第66章）第7條下所發出的指示妥為擬備。

# 意見的基礎

我已按照行政長官在《外匯基金條例》第7條下所發出的指示及審計署的審計準則進行審計。我根據該等準則而須承擔的責任，詳載於本報告「審計師就財務報表審計而須承擔的責任」部分。根據該等準則，我獨立於集團，並已按該等準則履行其他道德責任。我相信，我所獲得的審計憑證是充足和適當地為我的審計意見提供基礎。

# 關鍵審計事項

關鍵審計事項是根據我的專業判斷，對截至2024年12月31日止年度財務報表的審計最為重要的事項。我對整體財務報表進行審計及形成意見時處理了這些事項，而我不會對這些事項提供單獨的意見。

# 按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值

請參閱財務報表附註2.5、2.6及37.1。

於2024年12月31日，集團按公平值列帳的金融資產共 39,151.17 億港元，金融負債共 13,862.99 億港元。

86%的該等金融資產及所有該等金融負債的公平值為相同資產或負債於活躍市場的報價（第1級參數），或是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數是以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第2級參數）。

其餘14%的該等金融資產的公平值，是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數並非以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第3級參數）。有關金融資產共5,522.51億港元，主要包括非上市投資基金。

鑑於所涉數額龐大及涉及估計，按公平值列帳的金 融資產及金融負債的估值屬關鍵審計事項。

就按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值，審計程序包括：

- 了解不同類別金融資產及金融負債的估值程序，包括相關監控措施；

- 評價及測試監控措施，包括電腦系統的相關應用程式監控措施；
